meanings.definition: A title or form of address used to a man, typically followed by a surname.
meanings.sent1: The signor greeted his guests with a warm smile.
meanings.sent2: The signor, Mr. Johnson, arrived at the party in a stylish suit.
meanings.sent3: The signor's cat meowed back when he said hello.
meanings.sent4: The signor of the house, like a king in his castle, welcomed visitors graciously.
meanings.sent5: The signor, with his distinguished appearance, commanded respect from all who met him.

meanings.definition: A man who is a signatory to a document.
meanings.sent1: The signor signed the contract with a flourish.
meanings.sent2: The signor, a businessman, put his signature on the agreement.
meanings.sent3: The signor accidentally signed his name upside down on the paper.
meanings.sent4: The signor's signature on the paper was like a seal of approval.
meanings.sent5: The signor's penmanship was so elegant that his signature stood out on the document.
